Message.Msg: Four months after being released into the wild, no one seems to care that Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT ) Windows 8 has been desperately trying to reinvent the desktop PC experience. According to Net Applications, February was a downright awful month for Windows 8; it only gained 0.4% more of the desktop PC market. Since its debut, Windows 8 has only picked up an embarrassingly low 2.67% market share. For those keeping track at home, this pace is so awful that Microsoft Vista actually commanded more of the market after the same amount of time. Yikes. Considering that 65% of Windows-based PC sales are based on consumer spending, there's no possible way this development could be a good thing for Microsoft investors looking for share appreciation.

Topic.Title: Leaked email indicates President out to cause maximum pain for political gain via sequester

Message.Msg: Congressman Offers Amendment Defunding Obama’s Golf by Keith Koffler on March 6, 2013, 8:01 am Rep. Louis Gohmert (R-Texas) introduced an amendment to the fast-moving continuing resolution spending bill that would bar funding for President Obama’s golf outings until the White House reopens for public tours. Gohmert, who announced his amendment from the floor of the House, said Americans, whether Republicans or Democrats, will be greatly disappointed to come to Washington and not be able to get their tours of the White House. Many tours are planned well in advance. The amendment states: None of the funds made available by a division of this act may be used to transport the president to or from a golf course until public tours of the White House resume. Gohmert cited an estimate by Sen. Jeff Sessions, the ranking Republican on the Senate Budget Committee, that 341 federal employees could have avoided being furloughed had Obama not traveled to Florida for a three-day golf extravaganza. “Perhaps, quitting furloughing all these federal employees, we’ll be able to get the Democrats and Republicans across America (and) people that don’t even have a Party because they’re just Americans – they’ll be able to get their tour of the White House and all it will cost is one or two golf trips less,” Gohmert said. The amendment is unlikely to become law anytime soon, though because Republicans are moving the continuing resolution – which will fund the government at current levels through the rest of the fiscal year – without amendments. The “CR” is likely to come to a vote in the House today.

Message.Title: EU Fines Microsoft $732 Million In Browser Brawl
Message.Msg: Microsoft was fined 561 million euros ($732 million) Wednesday for a "serious infringement" of its agreement with European Union antitrust regulators. "Today, the commission adopted a decision sanctioning Microsoft for its failure to comply with the legally binding commitments which it made to the commission," said Joaquin Almunia, vice president of the European Commission and the commissioner responsible for its competition policies, at a Wednesday press conference in Brussels.

Topic.Title: EU Fine

Message.Msg: The fine does matter. It perpetrates the mistaken wide spread belief that MSFT cannot do anything right. EU may be acting in bad faith, but MSFT signed a document agreeing to the restrictions. They are now being held accountable for violating the agreement. This is not the first time MSFT has been fined. The total fines are approaching $2 billion dollars. Also there is a report circulating that MSFT owes back taxes in another European country. It is inappropriate to use a Holiday Party expense hyperbole to justify their inattention to detail. MSFT senior management should be held accountable through reduced bonuses.

Message.Title: This item will make your day
Message.Msg: Revenues approximately doubled last year as did earnings and expected again this year. Perfect size company (only 600 mil sales. Price needs to rise just to get to where the normal p/e of a typical fast growing company should be. It has a p/e of 22 and should have one of 40. Not only should the price rise for a higher p/e but also it should rocket up with the expected fast rise in earnings. We could easily see the price triple in one year considering these items. The SYMBOL: (AL) - a high profit airline leasing business. Company has billions of dollars in new jets ordered from Boeing and Airbus so obviously they expect a lot more business. I have 20 years experience evaluating hundreds of companies, this is one of the top 3 company stocks I have ever found. The company reported great earnings again and also leased 2 - Boeing 777's, and ordered 10 more Boeing 777's. Symbol (AL) Another interesting but more speculative stock is (edap). The company is big into ultrasound and they finished a study showing ultrasound works on prostate cancer without side effects like chemotherapy. The company is applying for approval with the FDA and it is expected to go through on a fast track because of the excellent results. This undiscovered company is priced at only $4. (edap)
